references.paper_title: A first-order primal-dual algorithm for convex problems with applications to imaging
references.reason: This paper introduces a first-order primal-dual algorithm that is foundational to many min-max optimization methods.

references.paper_title: Finite-Dimensional Variational Inequalities and Complementarity Problems
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of variational inequalities and complementarity problems, which are closely related to min-max optimization.

references.paper_title: On the complexity of the hybrid proximal extragradient method for the iterates and the ergodic mean
references.reason: This paper analyzes the iteration complexity of a second-order method for solving variational inequalities, which is relevant to the study of second-order min-max methods.

references.paper_title: Dual extrapolation and its applications to solving variational inequalities and related problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of dual extrapolation, which is crucial in the design of efficient algorithms for solving variational inequalities and saddle-point problems.
This paper introduces the optimistic method, which is a key building block for many modern min-max algorithms.
